data.title: Tune 2d editor arrow key move mode
data.body:
- default behavior: view base move
- alt + arrow key: local base move
- control/meta + arrow key: local base move + local rotation

```
const SCREEN_WIDTH = 360
```

data.title: Browsing for resources in scn/xscn/xml files
data.body: Just wondering if it would be possible to treat a scene as a directory when searching for resources. I think this would mainly be useful as I could find view-ports that are render targets easier than just knowing the path their in, and sharing resources across scenes would be easier to set up.

data.body: You can navigate further in the editor, but not using the horizontal scrollbar

data.title: [Crash] Segfault relating to Area2D.set_monitoring_enabled()
data.body:
**Preamble**: The crash seems to be related to using Area2D.set_enable_monitoring() on an Area2D created in code via .new(), set up and added to an existing node in the scene. 

It does not happen with every call to `set_monitoring_enabled()` but it happens with a reasonable frequency

GDB output follows.

```
ERROR: move: Condition ' !is_inside_scene() ' is true. returned: Vector2()
   At: scene/2d/physics_body_2d.cpp:758.
ERROR: move: Condition ' !is_inside_scene() ' is true. returned: Vector2()
   At: scene/2d/physics_body_2d.cpp:758.
ERROR: move: Condition ' !is_inside_scene() ' is true. returned: Vector2()
   At: scene/2d/physics_body_2d.cpp:758.

(this error is repeated many many times; might be relevant or not)

Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x087b6b86 in Vector<Area2D::ShapePair>::size (this=0x9d7e954) at core/vector.h:95
95                              return *reinterpret_cast<int*>(((uint8_t*)(_ptr))+sizeof(SafeRefCount));

(gdb) backtrace
#0  0x087b6b86 in Vector<Area2D::ShapePair>::size (this=0x9d7e954) at core/vector.h:95
#1  0x087b7061 in VSet<Area2D::ShapePair>::_find (this=0x9d7e954, p_val=..., r_exact=@0xbfffea6b: false) at core/vset.h:48
#2  0x087b6609 in VSet<Area2D::ShapePair>::insert (this=0x9d7e954, p_val=...) at core/vset.h:103
#3  0x087b2f45 in Area2D::_body_inout (this=0x9d66e00, p_status=0, p_body=..., p_instance=534, p_body_shape=0, p_area_shape=0)
    at scene/2d/area_2d.cpp:162
#4  0x0874fbfd in MethodBind5<int, RID const&, int, int, int>::call (this=0x9aaf940, p_object=0x9d66e00, p_args=0xbfffef48, p_arg_count=5, 
    r_error=...) at core/method_bind.inc:3017
#5  0x08b33ab0 in Object::call (this=0x9d66e00, p_method=..., p_args=0xbfffef48, p_argcount=5, r_error=...) at core/object.cpp:890
#6  0x089ba27d in Area2DSW::call_queries (this=0x9d66fa0) at servers/physics_2d/area_2d_sw.cpp:164
```

data.title: Make visibility icon always last to display in scene tree

data.title: KinematicBody2Ds don't respect the 'trigger' property
data.body:
The [2D physics tutorial triggers section](https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/wiki/tutorial_physics_2d#triggers) suggests that by setting the _'trigger'_ property on a CollisionShape2D, the KinematicBody will ignore collisions but still trigger **body_enter** etc events.

However, even with the _'trigger'_ property checked on two KinematicBody, they still collide.

(This may be superseded by for one of the bodies deselecting the _'collide_with'_ properties in the editor, or in-code via `set_collide_with_*(false)`; but there may be circumstances where this is not desirable)

data.title: Combination for x in range(state.get_contact_count()): state.get_contact_local_normal(x) broken on Android.
data.body:
#### Description

I started to be seeing this code snippet not working in latest builds. It hangs whole process defined in _integrate_forces method

``` python
for x in range(state.get_contact_count()):
        var ci = state.get_contact_local_normal(x)
```

Logcat ouput

> 05-08 11:20:54.618  16742-16759/? I/godot﹕ [1;31;40mERROR: load: [1;37;40mCondition ' local_path=="" ' is true. returned: RES()
> 05-08 11:20:54.618  16742-16759/? I/godot﹕ [0;31;40m   At: core/io/resource_loader.cpp:156.[0;0;37m
> 05-08 11:20:54.618  16742-16759/? I/godot﹕ [1;31;40mERROR: _integrate_forces: [1;37;40mInvalid type in built-in function 'load'. Cannot convert argument 1 from Nil to .
> 05-08 11:20:54.618  16742-16759/? I/godot﹕ [0;31;40m   At: res://player.gdc:86.[0;0;37m

My C/C++ background is not very solid (is not even decent :)) but I did a quick investigation and it looks like method RES ResourceLoader::load(const String &p_path,const String& p_type_hint,bool p_no_cache) is called somewhere in the stack starting from get_contact_local_normal(x) in godot script with first argument being invalid. 
#### Workaround

The simplest workaround is to add if (state.get_contact_count() > 0): logical condition before loop. 
#### Additional info
- "Platformer" demo is broken as it runs similar code snippet
-  Godot build from March 20th works and I use it for exporting to Android target. It should help tracking down guilty commit : )

data.title: Add lock and group icon to scene tree editor
data.body:
![](http://oi57.tinypic.com/8xpk5s.jpg)

Sometimes it's hard to know if your node is locked or grouped when it's overlapped by other nodes. Some icons on scene tree might help. 

And they are buttons too, so you can also unlock or ungroup the node by click on the icon.

data.title: Issues importing 3D scenes
data.body:
Originally [a thread posted on the forum](http://www.godotengine.org/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=552). I later posted about the z-buffer issue I mention in greater detail [as a separate thread](http://www.godotengine.org/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=560) with a minimal reproduction (as it's a general problem that doesn't have to do with 3D scene imports).

The Blender scene that I made to test this feature (as mentioned below), can be downloaded here: http://cheesekeg.com/listings/rocks_and_water.zip

To kick off my experimenting with Godot, I made a small 3D scene using Blender 2.7a containing the following objects:
- A sky-sphere (unshaded sphere mesh with a texture)
- A plane for water (reflective, slightly transparent plane with high specularity, a wavy normal map, and a noise texture)
- A mesh for rocks (with a normal map and texture)
- A hemi-lamp (a directional light; energy of 3 with a slight yellow tint)
- And, of course, a camera

Everything is generated from within Blender (including textures/normal maps).

Here's what it looks like rendered in Blender:
![Screenshot of Blender scene rendering](http://i.imgur.com/mZ7u9dN.png)

Firstly, I tried to export as-is (no export config changes) using the "Khronos Collada" exporter found [within the repository](https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/tree/master/tools/export/blender25):
![Screenshot of Khronos Collada export](http://i.imgur.com/NOKaBa4.png)

Immediately, I ran into this incompatibility issue with the hemi-lamp:
![Screenshot of incompatibility issue](http://i.imgur.com/LeRDYZY.png)

So I unchecked "Lamp" in the exporter's settings:
![Screenshot of Khronos Collada export settings](http://i.imgur.com/QYMJZhL.png)
...and the DAE export succeeded, so I imported it with Godot and added a "Direction Light" to start (since I couldn't export the hemi-lamp):
![Screenshot of 3D scene imported with Godot](http://i.imgur.com/9iongZ1.png)

After correcting the camera's FOV, here's what it looks like in the editor:
![Screenshot of 3D scene from the camera's perspective in Godot](http://i.imgur.com/e8KgeqH.png)

...and here's what it looks like in-game:
![Screenshot of 3D scene in-game with Godot](http://i.imgur.com/oafdwgf.png)

As you can see, I'm running into a few problems here:
- **The rock mesh is drawing over the water completely! (z-buffer issues?)** Also, in the editor, the opposite is happening (the water is drawing over the rock mesh completely!)
- None of the textures/normal maps carried over

There are probably a few more things that I could list, but most other issues are easily fixable by readjusting the settings for each object anyhow.

I zipped the blend file and tossed it up here: http://cheesekeg.com/listings/rocks_and_water.zip

data.title: RigidBody2D body_enter() signal fails with tilemap.
data.body:
When the rigid body touches a static body inside the same scene the signals are triggered, but when
it touches a tilemap which contains static bodies (as in tilemap tutorial) it won't trigger the signal.

Simple testfile:
http://www.mediafire.com/download/u9avx5ugth91w88/collisionfail.zip

data.title: Contextual help for Script Editor
data.body:
- Press Shift + F1 to display help for selected text or word under cursor
- Add "get_word_under_cursor" to TextEdit api
- EditoNode only consume F1 key when no Shift or Command been pressed

Known issue:
When help tab been invoked first time, it scroll to wrong position. After the that, it works as expected.

See post http://www.godotengine.org/forum/viewtopic.php?f=8&t=546&start=10#p2317 for more info.

data.title: Independent tabs
data.body:
I do not understand why script tabs closing when I opening another scene. 
Scripts are shared by number of scenes and it is idiotic to add in resources each time.
IT IS NOT OBVIOUS. I spend time on this ...... 
Why dont make script tabs as in every normal editor?
The same for scenes in 2d. Why don't make in independent. You want to open scene? 
Alright, add a new tab. Wanna close it - do it. What the weird logic with scenes ?
